thread.title: Southampton striker Gabbiadini impressing Puel with impact | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Southampton striker Gabbiadini impressing Puel with impact | Daily Mail Online

author: Neil Robinson
title: Southampton striker Gabbiadini impressing Puel with impact | Daily Mail Online
text: comments In 163 minutes of football for Southampton since arriving for Â£14million on transfer deadline day, Manolo Gabbiadini has scored three times in two appearances - more than 10 per cent of the club's Premier League goals this season. Add to that goals in his final two appearances for Napoli and you have to go back to the start of December to find a game in which Gabbiadini did not score - a 56-minute Champions League appearance against Benfica. So the last thing the Italian wanted after his brace against Sunderland earlier this month was the enforced two week's rest that has followed. Manolo Gabbiadini scored twice against Sunderland in a 4-0 victory at the Stadium of Light But with Southampton already out of the FA Cup, they have had plenty of time to focus on Sunday's League Cup final against Manchester United. Gabbiadini is expected to lead the attack in what is their first cup final appearance since 1979, when they lost 3-2 to Nottingham Forest in the same competition. And Saints manager Claude Puel is delighted with Gabbiadini's instant impact, which has seen him become the first Southampton player to score in his opening two Premier League games since Henri Camara in 2005. Southampton boss Claude Puel celebrates reaching the EFL Cup final with a win at Anfield RELATED ARTICLES
